questiontext.text:
Exercise

Let \(A\) and \(B\) be intersecting sets, i.e. are not disjoint. Consider the following Venn diagrams.


The shaded area of diagram (a) represents [[1]]

The shaded area of diagram (b) represents [[2]]

The shaded area of diagram (c) represents [[3]]

The shaded area of diagram (d) represents [[4]]

The shaded area of diagram (e) represents [[5]]

generalfeedback.text:
Note the following equivalent definitions:
(c) \(A \cup B' = (A' \cap B)'\)
(d) \(A' \cup B' = (A \cap B)'\)
(e) \(A' \cap B' = (A \cup B)'\)
